   20: 
   21: -module(monitor_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: -include_lib("eunit/include/eunit.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   27:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   28:          case_1/1, case_1a/1, case_2/1, case_2a/1, mon_e_1/1, demon_e_1/1, demon_1/1,
   29:          demon_2/1, demon_3/1, demonitor_flush/1, gh_5225_demonitor_alias/1,
   30:          local_remove_monitor/1, remote_remove_monitor/1, mon_1/1, mon_2/1,
   31:          large_exit/1, list_cleanup/1, mixer/1, named_down/1, otp_5827/1,
   32:          monitor_time_offset/1, monitor_tag_storage/1,
   33:          unexpected_alias_at_demonitor_gh5310/1,
   34:          down_on_alias_gh5310/1, monitor_3_noproc_gh6185/1]).
   35: 
   36: -export([y2/1, g/1, g0/0, g1/0, large_exit_sub/1]).
   37: 
   38: suite() ->
   39:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   40:      {timetrap, {seconds, 30}}].
   41: 
   42: all() -> 
   43:     [case_1, case_1a, case_2, case_2a, mon_e_1, demon_e_1,
   44:      demon_1, mon_1, mon_2, demon_2, demon_3, demonitor_flush,
   45:      gh_5225_demonitor_alias, {group, remove_monitor}, large_exit,
   46:      list_cleanup, mixer, named_down, otp_5827,
   47:      monitor_time_offset, monitor_tag_storage,
   48:      unexpected_alias_at_demonitor_gh5310,
   49:      down_on_alias_gh5310, monitor_3_noproc_gh6185].
   50: 
   51: groups() -> 
   52:     [{remove_monitor, [],
   53:       [local_remove_monitor, remote_remove_monitor]}].
   54: 
   55: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   56:     Config.
   57: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   58:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   59: 
   60: %% A monitors B, B kills A and then exits (yielded core dump)
   61: case_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   62:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
   63:     spawn_link(?MODULE, g0, []),
   64:     receive _ -> ok end,
   65:     ok.
   66: 
   67: %% A monitors B, B kills A and then exits (yielded core dump)
   68: case_1a(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   69:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
   70:     spawn_link(?MODULE, g1, []),
   71:     receive _ -> ok end,
   72:     ok.
   73: 
   74: g0() ->
   75:     B = spawn(?MODULE, g, [self()]),
   76:     erlang:monitor(process, B),
   77:     B ! ok,
   78:     receive ok -> ok end,
   79:     ok.
   80: 
   81: g1() ->
   82:     {B,_} = spawn_monitor(?MODULE, g, [self()]),
   83:     B ! ok,
   84:     receive ok -> ok end,
   85:     ok.
   86: 
   87: g(Parent) ->
   88:     receive ok -> ok end,
   89:     exit(Parent, foo),
   90:     ok.
   91: 
   92: 
   93: %% A monitors B, B demonitors A (yielded core dump)
   94: case_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   95:     B = spawn(?MODULE, y2, [self()]),
   96:     R = erlang:monitor(process, B),
   97:     B ! R,
   98:     receive
   99:         true -> ok;
  100:         Other ->
  101:             ct:fail({rec, Other})
  102:     end,
  103:     expect_down(R, B, normal),
  104:     ok.
  105: 
  106: %% A monitors B, B demonitors A (yielded core dump)
  107: case_2a(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  108:     {B,R} = spawn_monitor(?MODULE, y2, [self()]),
  109:     B ! R,
  110:     receive
  111:         true -> ok;
  112:         Other ->
  113:             ct:fail({rec, Other})
  114:     end,
  115:     expect_down(R, B, normal),
  116:     ok.
  117: 
  118: y2(Parent) ->
  119:     R = receive T -> T end,
  120:     Parent ! (catch erlang:demonitor(R)),
  121:     ok.
  122: 
  123: expect_down(Ref, P) ->
  124:     receive
  125:         {'DOWN', Ref, process, P, Reason} -> 
  126:             Reason;
  127:         Other ->
  128:             ct:fail({rec, Other})
  129:     end.
  130: 
  131: expect_down(Ref, P, Reason) ->
  132:     receive
  133:         {'DOWN', Ref, process, P, Reason} -> 
  134:             ok;
  135:         Other ->
  136:             ct:fail({rec, Other})
  137:     end.
  138: 
  139: expect_no_msg() ->
  140:     receive
  141:         Msg ->
  142:             ct:fail({msg, Msg})
  143:     after 0 ->
  144:               ok
  145:     end.
  146: 
  147: %%% Error cases for monitor/2
  148: 
  149: mon_e_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  150:     {ok, Peer, N} = ?CT_PEER(),
  151:     mon_error(plutt, self()),
  152:     mon_error(process, [bingo]),
  153:     mon_error(process, {rex, N, junk}),
  154:     mon_error(process, 1),
  155: 
  156:     peer:stop(Peer),
  157:     ok.
  158: 
  159: %%% We would also like to have a test case that tries to monitor something
  160: %%% on an R5 node, but this isn't possible to do systematically.
  161: %%%
  162: %%% Likewise against an R6 node, which is not capable of monitoring
  163: %%% by name, which gives a badarg on the R7 node at the call to
  164: %%% erlang:monitor(process, {Name, Node}). This has been tested 
  165: %%% manually at least once.
  166: 
  167: mon_error(Type, Item) ->
  168:     case catch erlang:monitor(Type, Item) of
  169:         {'EXIT', _} ->
  170:             ok;
  171:         Other ->
  172:             ct:fail({err, Other})
  173:     end.
  174: 
  175: %%% Error cases for demonitor/1
  176: 
  177: demon_e_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  178:     {ok, Peer, N} = ?CT_PEER(),
  179:     demon_error(plutt, badarg),
  180:     demon_error(1, badarg),
  181: 
  182:     %% Demonitor with ref created at other node
  183:     R1 = rpc:call(N, erlang, make_ref, []),
  184:     demon_error(R1, badarg),
  185: 
  186:     %% Demonitor with ref created at wrong monitor link end
  187:     P0 = self(),
  188:     P2 = spawn(
  189:            fun() ->
  190:                    P0 ! {self(), ref, erlang:monitor(process,P0)},
  191:                    receive {P0, stop} -> ok end
  192:            end ),
  193:     receive 
  194:         {P2, ref, R2} -> 
  195:             true = erlang:demonitor(R2),
  196:             P2 ! {self(), stop};
  197:         Other2 ->
  198:             ct:fail({rec, Other2})
  199:     end,
  200: 
  201:     peer:stop(Peer),
  202:     ok.
  203: 
  204: demon_error(Ref, Reason) ->
  205:     case catch erlang:demonitor(Ref) of
  206:         {'EXIT', {Reason, _}} ->
  207:             ok;
  208:         Other ->
  209:             ct:fail({err, Other})
  210:     end.
  211: 
  212: %%% No-op cases for demonitor/1
  213: 
  214: demon_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  215:     true = erlang:demonitor(make_ref()),
  216:     ok.
  217: 
  218: 
  219: %%% Cases for demonitor/1
  220: 
  221: demon_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  222:     R1 = erlang:monitor(process, self()),
  223:     true = erlang:demonitor(R1),
  224:     %% Extra demonitor
  225:     true = erlang:demonitor(R1),
  226:     expect_no_msg(),
  227: 
  228:     %% Normal 'DOWN'
  229:     P2 = spawn(timer, sleep, [1]),
  230:     R2 = erlang:monitor(process, P2),
  231:     case expect_down(R2, P2) of
  232:         normal -> ok;
  233:         noproc -> ok;
  234:         BadReason -> ct:fail({bad_reason, BadReason})
  235:     end,
  236: 
  237:     %% OTP-5772
  238:     %     %% 'DOWN' before demonitor
  239:     %     P3 = spawn(timer, sleep, [100000]),
  240:     %     R3 = erlang:monitor(process, P3),
  241:     %     exit(P3, frop),
  242:     %     erlang:demonitor(R3),
  243:     %     expect_down(R3, P3, frop),
  244: 
  245:     %% Demonitor before 'DOWN'
  246:     P4 = spawn(timer, sleep, [100000]),
  247:     R4 = erlang:monitor(process, P4),
  248:     erlang:demonitor(R4),
  249:     exit(P4, frop),
  250:     expect_no_msg(),
  251: 
  252:     ok.
  253: 
  254: %% Distributed case for demonitor/1 (OTP-3499)
  255: demon_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  256:     {ok, Peer, N} = ?CT_PEER(),
  257: 
  258:     %% 'DOWN' before demonitor
  259:     P2 = spawn(N, timer, sleep, [100000]),
  260:     R2 = erlang:monitor(process, P2),
  261:     peer:stop(Peer),
  262:     true = erlang:demonitor(R2),
  263:     expect_down(R2, P2, noconnection),
  264: 
  265:     {ok, Peer2, N2} = ?CT_PEER(),
  266: 
  267:     %% Demonitor before 'DOWN'
  268:     P3 = spawn(N2, timer, sleep, [100000]),
  269:     R3 = erlang:monitor(process, P3),
  270:     true = erlang:demonitor(R3),
  271:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  272:     expect_no_msg(),
  273: 
  274:     ok.
  275: 
  276: demonitor_flush(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  277:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:demonitor(make_ref(), flush)),
  278:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:demonitor(make_ref(), [flus])),
  279:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch erlang:demonitor(x, [flush])),
  280:     {ok, Peer, N} = ?CT_PEER(),
  281:     ok = demonitor_flush_test(N),
  282:     peer:stop(Peer),
  283:     ok = demonitor_flush_test(node()).
  284: 
  285: demonitor_flush_test(Node) ->
  286:     P = spawn(Node, timer, sleep, [100000]),
  287:     M1 = erlang:monitor(process, P),
  288:     M2 = erlang:monitor(process, P),
  289:     M3 = erlang:monitor(process, P),
  290:     M4 = erlang:monitor(process, P),
  291:     true = erlang:demonitor(M1, [flush, flush]),
  292:     exit(P, bang),
  293:     receive {'DOWN', M2, process, P, bang} -> ok end,
  294:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  295:     true = erlang:demonitor(M3, [flush]),
  296:     true = erlang:demonitor(M4, []),
  297:     receive {'DOWN', M4, process, P, bang} -> ok end,
  298:     receive
  299:         {'DOWN', M, _, _, _} =DM when M == M1,
  300:                                       M == M3 ->
  301:             ct:fail({unexpected_down_message, DM})
  302:     after 100 ->
  303:               ok
  304:     end.
  305: 
  306: gh_5225_demonitor_alias(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  307:     %% Demonitor using a reference that was an active alias, but not an
  308:     %% active monitor, used to crash the runtime system.
  309:     Alias = alias(),
  310:     erlang:demonitor(Alias),
  311:     erlang:demonitor(Alias, [flush]),
  312:     {Pid, MonAlias1} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  313:                                          ok
  314:                                  end,
  315:                                  [{monitor, [{alias, explicit_unalias}]}]),
  316:     receive {'DOWN', MonAlias1, process, Pid, normal} -> ok end,
  317:     erlang:demonitor(MonAlias1),
  318:     erlang:demonitor(MonAlias1, [flush]),
  319:     MonAlias2 = erlang:monitor(process, Pid, [{alias, explicit_unalias}]),
  320:     receive {'DOWN', MonAlias2, process, Pid, noproc} -> ok end,
  321:     erlang:demonitor(MonAlias2),
  322:     erlang:demonitor(MonAlias2, [flush]),
  323:     ok.
  324: 
  325: -define(RM_MON_GROUPS, 100).
  326: -define(RM_MON_GPROCS, 100).
  327: 
  328: 
  329: local_remove_monitor(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  330:     Gs = generate(fun () -> start_remove_monitor_group(node()) end,
  331:                   ?RM_MON_GROUPS),
  332:     {True, False} = lists:foldl(fun (G, {T, F}) ->
  333:                                         receive
  334:                                             {rm_mon_res, G, {GT, GF}} ->
  335:                                                 {T+GT, F+GF}
  336:                                         end
  337:                                 end,
  338:                                 {0, 0},
  339:                                 Gs),
  340:     erlang:display({local_remove_monitor, True, False}),
  341:     {comment,
  342:      "True = "++integer_to_list(True)++"; False = "++integer_to_list(False)}.
  343: 
  344: remote_remove_monitor(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  345:     {ok, Peer, N} = ?CT_PEER(),
  346:     Gs = generate(fun () -> start_remove_monitor_group(N) end,
  347:                   ?RM_MON_GROUPS),
  348:     {True, False} = lists:foldl(fun (G, {T, F}) ->
  349:                                         receive
  350:                                             {rm_mon_res, G, {GT, GF}} ->
  351:                                                 {T+GT, F+GF}
  352:                                         end
  353:                                 end,
  354:                                 {0, 0},
  355:                                 Gs),
  356:     erlang:display({remote_remove_monitor, True, False}),
  357:     peer:stop(Peer),
  358:     {comment,
  359:      "True = "++integer_to_list(True)++"; False = "++integer_to_list(False)}.
  360: 
  361: start_remove_monitor_group(Node) ->
  362:     Master = self(),
  363:     spawn_link(
  364:       fun () ->
  365:               Ms = generate(fun () ->
  366:                                     P = spawn(Node, fun () -> ok end),
  367:                                     erlang:monitor(process, P)
  368:                             end, ?RM_MON_GPROCS),
  369:               Res = lists:foldl(fun (M, {T, F}) ->
  370:                                         case erlang:demonitor(M, [info]) of
  371:                                             true ->
  372:                                                 receive
  373:                                                     {'DOWN', M, _, _, _} ->
  374:                                                         exit(down_msg_found)
  375:                                                 after 0 ->
  376:                                                           ok
  377:                                                 end,
  378:                                                 {T+1, F};
  379:                                             false ->
  380:                                                 receive
  381:                                                     {'DOWN', M, _, _, _} ->
  382:                                                         ok
  383:                                                 after 0 ->
  384:                                                           exit(no_down_msg_found)
  385:                                                 end,
  386:                                                 {T, F+1}
  387:                                         end
  388:                                 end,
  389:                                 {0,0},
  390:                                 Ms),
  391:               Master ! {rm_mon_res, self(), Res}
  392:       end).
  393: 
  394: 
  395: %%% Cases for monitor/2
  396: 
  397: mon_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  398:     %% Normal case
  399:     P2 = spawn(timer, sleep, [1]),
  400:     R2 = erlang:monitor(process, P2),
  401:     case expect_down(R2, P2) of
  402:         normal -> ok;
  403:         noproc -> ok;
  404:         BadReason -> ct:fail({bad_reason, BadReason})
  405:     end,
  406:     {P2A,R2A} = spawn_monitor(timer, sleep, [1]),
  407:     expect_down(R2A, P2A, normal),
  408: 
  409:     %% 'DOWN' with other reason
  410:     P3 = spawn(timer, sleep, [100000]),
  411:     R3 = erlang:monitor(process, P3),
  412:     exit(P3, frop),
  413:     expect_down(R3, P3, frop),
  414:     {P3A,R3A} = spawn_monitor(timer, sleep, [100000]),
  415:     exit(P3A, frop),
  416:     expect_down(R3A, P3A, frop),
  417: 
  418:     %% Monitor fails because process is dead
  419:     R4 = erlang:monitor(process, P3),
  420:     expect_down(R4, P3, noproc),
  421: 
  422:     %% Normal case (named process)
  423:     P5 = start_jeeves(jeeves),
  424:     R5 = erlang:monitor(process, jeeves),
  425:     tell_jeeves(P5, stop),
  426:     expect_down(R5, {jeeves, node()}, normal),
  427: 
  428:     %% 'DOWN' with other reason and node explicit activation
  429:     P6 = start_jeeves(jeeves),
  430:     R6 = erlang:monitor(process, {jeeves, node()}),
  431:     tell_jeeves(P6, {exit, frop}),
  432:     expect_down(R6, {jeeves, node()}, frop),
  433: 
  434:     %% Monitor (named process) fails because process is dead
  435:     R7 = erlang:monitor(process, {jeeves, node()}),
  436:     expect_down(R7, {jeeves, node()}, noproc),
  437: 
  438:     ok.
  439: 
  440: %% Distributed cases for monitor/2
  441: mon_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  442:     {ok, Peer, N1} = ?CT_PEER(),
  443: 
  444:     %% Normal case
  445:     P2 = spawn(N1, timer, sleep, [4000]),
  446:     R2 = erlang:monitor(process, P2),
  447:     expect_down(R2, P2, normal),
  448: 
  449:     %% 'DOWN' with other reason
  450:     P3 = spawn(N1, timer, sleep, [100000]),
  451:     R3 = erlang:monitor(process, P3),
  452:     exit(P3, frop),
  453:     expect_down(R3, P3, frop),
  454: 
  455:     %% Monitor fails because process is dead
  456:     R4 = erlang:monitor(process, P3),
  457:     expect_down(R4, P3, noproc),
  458: 
  459:     %% Other node goes down
  460:     P5 = spawn(N1, timer, sleep, [100000]),
  461:     R5 = erlang:monitor(process, P5),
  462: 
  463:     peer:stop(Peer),
  464: 
  465:     expect_down(R5, P5, noconnection),
  466: 
  467:     %% Monitor fails because other node is dead
  468:     P6 = spawn(N1, timer, sleep, [100000]),
  469:     R6 = erlang:monitor(process, P6),
  470:     R6_Reason = expect_down(R6, P6),
  471:     true = (R6_Reason == noconnection) orelse (R6_Reason == noproc),
  472: 
  473:     %% Start a new node that can load code in this module
  474:     {ok, Peer2, N2} = ?CT_PEER(),
  475: 
  476:     %% Normal case (named process)
  477:     P7 = start_jeeves({jeeves, N2}),
  478:     R7 = erlang:monitor(process, {jeeves, N2}),
  479:     tell_jeeves(P7, stop),
  480:     expect_down(R7, {jeeves, N2}, normal),
  481: 
  482:     %% 'DOWN' with other reason (named process)
  483:     P8 = start_jeeves({jeeves, N2}),
  484:     R8 = erlang:monitor(process, {jeeves, N2}),
  485:     tell_jeeves(P8, {exit, frop}),
  486:     expect_down(R8, {jeeves, N2}, frop),
  487: 
  488:     %% Monitor (named process) fails because process is dead
  489:     R9 = erlang:monitor(process, {jeeves, N2}),
  490:     expect_down(R9, {jeeves, N2}, noproc),
  491: 
  492:     %% Other node goes down (named process)
  493:     _P10 = start_jeeves({jeeves, N2}),
  494:     R10 = erlang:monitor(process, {jeeves, N2}),
  495: 
  496:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  497: 
  498:     expect_down(R10, {jeeves, N2}, noconnection),
  499: 
  500:     %% Monitor (named process) fails because other node is dead
  501:     R11 = erlang:monitor(process, {jeeves, N2}),
  502:     expect_down(R11, {jeeves, N2}, noconnection),
  503: 
  504:     ok.
  505: 
  506: %%% Large exit reason. Crashed first attempt to release R5B.
  507: 
  508: large_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  509:     f(100),
  510:     ok.
  511: 
  512: f(0) ->
  513:     ok;
  514: f(N) ->
  515:     f(),
  516:     f(N-1).
  517: 
  518: f() ->
  519:     S0 = {big, tuple, with, [list, 4563784278]},
  520:     S = {S0, term_to_binary(S0)},
  521:     P = spawn(?MODULE, large_exit_sub, [S]),
  522:     R = erlang:monitor(process, P),
  523:     P ! hej,
  524:     receive
  525:         {'DOWN', R, process, P, X} ->
  526:             io:format(" -> ~p~n", [X]),
  527:             if
  528:                 X == S ->
  529:                     ok;
  530:                 true ->
  531:                     ct:fail({X, S})
  532:             end;
  533:         Other ->
  534:             io:format(" -> ~p~n", [Other]),
  535:             exit({answer, Other})
  536:     end.
  537: 
  538: large_exit_sub(S) ->
  539:     receive _X -> ok end,
  540:     exit(S).
  541: 
  542: %%% Testing of monitor link list cleanup
  543: %%% by using erlang:process_info(self(), monitors)
  544: %%% and      erlang:process_info(self(), monitored_by)
  545: 
  546: list_cleanup(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  547:     P0 = self(),
  548:     M  = node(),
  549:     true = register(master_bertie, self()),
  550: 
  551:     %% Normal local case, monitor and demonitor
  552:     P1 = start_jeeves(jeeves),
  553:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  554:     expect_jeeves(P1, monitors, {monitors, {[], []}}),
  555:     R1a = erlang:monitor(process, P1),
  556:     {[{process, P1}], []} = monitors(),
  557:     expect_jeeves(P1, monitors, {monitors, {[], [P0]}}),
  558:     true = erlang:demonitor(R1a),
  559:     expect_no_msg(),
  560:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  561:     expect_jeeves(P1, monitors, {monitors, {[], []}}),
  562:     %% Remonitor named and try again, now exiting the monitored process
  563:     R1b = erlang:monitor(process, jeeves),
  564:     {[{process, {jeeves, M}}], []} = monitors(),
  565:     expect_jeeves(P1, monitors, {monitors, {[], [P0]}}),
  566:     tell_jeeves(P1, stop),
  567:     expect_down(R1b, {jeeves, node()}, normal),
  568:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  569: 
  570:     %% Slightly weird local case - the monitoring process crashes
  571:     P2 = start_jeeves(jeeves),
  572:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  573:     expect_jeeves(P2, monitors, {monitors, {[], []}}),
  574:     {monitor_process, _R2} = 
  575:     ask_jeeves(P2, {monitor_process, master_bertie}),
  576:     {[], [P2]} = monitors(),
  577:     expect_jeeves(P2, monitors,
  578:                   {monitors, {[{process, {master_bertie, node()}}], []}}),
  579:     tell_jeeves(P2, {exit, frop}),
  580:     timer:sleep(2000),
  581:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  582: 
  583:     %% Start a new node that can load code in this module
  584:     {ok, Peer, J} = ?CT_PEER(),
  585: 
  586:     %% Normal remote case, monitor and demonitor
  587:     P3 = start_jeeves({jeeves, J}),
  588:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  589:     expect_jeeves(P3, monitors, {monitors, {[], []}}),
  590:     R3a = erlang:monitor(process, P3),
  591:     {[{process, P3}], []} = monitors(),
  592:     expect_jeeves(P3, monitors, {monitors, {[], [P0]}}),
  593:     true = erlang:demonitor(R3a),
  594:     expect_no_msg(),
  595:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  596:     expect_jeeves(P3, monitors, {monitors, {[], []}}),
  597:     %% Remonitor named and try again, now exiting the monitored process
  598:     R3b = erlang:monitor(process, {jeeves, J}),
  599:     {[{process, {jeeves, J}}], []} = monitors(),
  600:     expect_jeeves(P3, monitors, {monitors, {[], [P0]}}),
  601:     tell_jeeves(P3, stop),
  602:     expect_down(R3b, {jeeves, J}, normal),
  603:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  604: 
  605:     %% Slightly weird remote case - the monitoring process crashes
  606:     P4 = start_jeeves({jeeves, J}),
  607:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  608:     expect_jeeves(P4, monitors, {monitors, {[], []}}),
  609:     {monitor_process, _R4} = 
  610:     ask_jeeves(P4, {monitor_process, {master_bertie, M}}),
  611:     {[], [P4]} = monitors(),
  612:     expect_jeeves(P4, monitors, 
  613:                   {monitors, {[{process, {master_bertie, M}}], []}} ),
  614:     tell_jeeves(P4, {exit, frop}),
  615:     timer:sleep(2000),
  616:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  617: 
  618:     %% Now, the monitoring remote node crashes
  619:     P5 = start_jeeves({jeeves, J}),
  620:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  621:     expect_jeeves(P5, monitors, {monitors, {[], []}}),
  622:     {monitor_process, _R5} = 
  623:     ask_jeeves(P5, {monitor_process, P0}),
  624:     {[], [P5]} = monitors(),
  625:     expect_jeeves(P5, monitors, 
  626:                   {monitors, {[{process, P0}], []}} ),
  627:     peer:stop(Peer),
  628:     timer:sleep(4000),
  629:     {[], []} = monitors(),
  630: 
  631:     true = unregister(master_bertie),
  632:     ok.
  633: 
  634: 
  635: %%% Mixed internal and external monitors
  636: 
  637: mixer(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  638:     {_, Peers, NL0} = lists:unzip3([?CT_PEER() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 3)]),
  639:     NL1 = lists:duplicate(2,node()) ++ NL0,
  640:     Perm = perm(NL1),
  641:     lists:foreach(
  642:       fun(NL) ->
  643:               Js = [start_jeeves({[],M}) || M <- (NL ++ NL)],
  644:               [ask_jeeves(P,{monitor_process,self()}) || P <- Js],
  645:               {monitored_by,MB} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
  646:               MBL = lists:sort(MB),
  647:               JsL = lists:sort(Js),
  648:               MBL = JsL,
  649:               {monitors,[]}  = process_info(self(),monitors),
  650:               [tell_jeeves(P,{exit,flaff}) || P <- Js],
  651:               wait_for_m([],[],200)
  652:       end,
  653:       Perm),
  654:     lists:foreach(
  655:       fun(NL) ->
  656:               Js = [start_jeeves({[],M}) || M <- (NL ++ NL)],
  657:               Rs = [begin
  658:                         {monitor_process,Ref} = ask_jeeves(P,{monitor_process,self()}),
  659:                         {P,Ref}
  660:                     end || P <- Js],
  661:               {monitored_by,MB} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
  662:               MBL = lists:sort(MB),
  663:               JsL = lists:sort(Js),
  664:               MBL = JsL,
  665:               {monitors,[]}  = process_info(self(),monitors),
  666:               [ask_jeeves(P,{demonitor,Ref}) || {P,Ref} <- Rs],
  667:               wait_for_m([],[],200),
  668:               [tell_jeeves(P,{exit,flaff}) || P <- Js]
  669:       end,
  670:       Perm),
  671:     lists:foreach(
  672:       fun(NL) ->
  673:               Js = [start_jeeves({[],M}) || M <- (NL ++ NL)],
  674:               [ask_jeeves(P,{monitor_process,self()}) || P <- Js],
  675:               [erlang:monitor(process,P) || P <- Js],
  676:               {monitored_by,MB} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
  677:               MBL = lists:sort(MB),
  678:               JsL = lists:sort(Js),
  679:               MBL = JsL,
  680:               {monitors,M} = process_info(self(),monitors),
  681:               ML = lists:sort([P||{process,P} <- M]),
  682:               ML = JsL,
  683:               [begin
  684:                    tell_jeeves(P,{exit,flaff}),
  685:                    receive {'DOWN',_,process,P,_} -> ok end
  686:                end || P <- Js],
  687:               wait_for_m([],[],200)
  688:       end,
  689:       Perm),
  690:     lists:foreach(
  691:       fun(NL) ->
  692:               Js = [start_jeeves({[],M}) || M <- (NL ++ NL)],
  693:               Rs = [begin
  694:                         {monitor_process,Ref} = ask_jeeves(P,{monitor_process,self()}),
  695:                         {P,Ref}
  696:                     end || P <- Js],
  697:               R2s = [{P,erlang:monitor(process,P)} || P <- Js],
  698:               {monitored_by,MB} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
  699:               MBL = lists:sort(MB),
  700:               JsL = lists:sort(Js),
  701:               MBL = JsL,
  702:               {monitors,M} = process_info(self(),monitors),
  703:               ML = lists:sort([P||{process,P} <- M]),
  704:               ML = JsL,
  705:               [ask_jeeves(P,{demonitor,Ref}) || {P,Ref} <- Rs],
  706:               wait_for_m(lists:sort(M),[],200),
  707:               [erlang:demonitor(Ref) || {_P,Ref} <- R2s],
  708:               wait_for_m([],[],200),
  709:               [tell_jeeves(P,{exit,flaff}) || P <- Js]
  710:       end,
  711:       Perm),
  712:     [peer:stop(P) || P <- Peers],
  713:     ok.
  714: 
  715: %% Test that DOWN message for a named monitor isn't
  716: %%  delivered until name has been unregistered
  717: named_down(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  718:     Name = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  719:                         ++ "-named_down-"
  720:                         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(second))
  721:                         ++ "-" ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive]))),
  722:     Prio = process_flag(priority,high),
  723:     %% Spawn a bunch of high prio cpu bound processes to prevent
  724:     %% normal prio processes from terminating during the next
  725:     %% 500 ms...
  726:     Self = self(),
  727:     spawn_opt(fun () ->
  728:                       WFun = fun
  729:                                  (F, hej) -> F(F, hopp);
  730:                                  (F, hopp) -> F(F, hej)
  731:                              end,
  732:                       NoSchedulers = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  733:                       lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
  734:                                             spawn_opt(fun () ->
  735:                                                               WFun(WFun,
  736:                                                                    hej)
  737:                                                       end,
  738:                                                       [{priority,high},
  739:                                                        link])
  740:                                     end,
  741:                                     lists:seq(1, NoSchedulers)),
  742:                       receive after 500 -> ok end,
  743:                       unlink(Self),
  744:                       exit(bang)
  745:               end,
  746:               [{priority,high}, link]),
  747:     NamedProc = spawn_link(fun () ->
  748:                                    receive after infinity -> ok end
  749:                            end),
  750:     ?assertEqual(true, register(Name, NamedProc)),
  751:     unlink(NamedProc),
  752:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Name),
  753:     exit(NamedProc, bang),
  754:     receive {'DOWN',Mon, _, _, bang} -> ok
  755:     after 3000 -> ?assert(false) end,
  756:     ?assertEqual(true, register(Name, self())),
  757:     ?assertEqual(true, unregister(Name)),
  758:     process_flag(priority,Prio),
  759:     ok.
  760: 
  761: otp_5827(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  762:     %% Make a pid with the same nodename but with another creation
  763:     [CreEnd | RPTail]
  764:     = lists:reverse(binary_to_list(term_to_binary(self()))),
  765:     NewCreEnd = case CreEnd of
  766:                     0 -> 1;
  767:                     1 -> 2;
  768:                     _ -> CreEnd - 1
  769:                 end,
  770:     OtherCreationPid
  771:     = binary_to_term(list_to_binary(lists:reverse([NewCreEnd | RPTail]))),
  772:     %% If the bug is present erlang:monitor(process, OtherCreationPid)
  773:     %% will hang...
  774:     Parent = self(),
  775:     Ok = make_ref(),
  776:     spawn(fun () ->
  777:                   Mon = erlang:monitor(process, OtherCreationPid),
  778:                   % Should get the DOWN message right away
  779:                   receive
  780:                       {'DOWN', Mon, process, OtherCreationPid, noproc} ->
  781:                           Parent ! Ok
  782:                   end
  783:           end),
  784:     receive
  785:         Ok ->
  786:             ok
  787:     after 1000 ->
  788:               ct:fail("erlang:monitor/2 hangs")
  789:     end.
  790: 
  791: monitor_time_offset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  792:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+C", "single_time_warp"]),
  793:     Me = self(),
  794:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  795:                             Pid = spawn(Node,
  796:                                         fun () ->
  797:                                                 check_monitor_time_offset(Me)
  798:                                         end),
  799:                             {Pid, erlang:monitor(process, Pid)}
  800:                     end,
  801:                     lists:seq(1, 100)),
  802:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) ->
  803:                           P ! check_no_change_message
  804:                   end, PMs),
  805:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
  806:                           receive
  807:                               {no_change_message_received, P} ->
  808:                                   ok;
  809:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, Reason} ->
  810:                                   ct:fail(Reason)
  811:                           end
  812:                   end, PMs),
  813:     preliminary = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_flag, [time_offset, finalize]),
  814:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
  815:                           receive
  816:                               {change_messages_received, P} ->
  817:                                   erlang:demonitor(M, [flush]);
  818:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, Reason} ->
  819:                                   ct:fail(Reason)
  820:                           end
  821:                   end, PMs),
  822:     peer:stop(Peer),
  823:     ok.
  824: 
  825: check_monitor_time_offset(Leader) ->
  826:     Mon1 = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  827:     Mon2 = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  828:     Mon3 = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  829:     Mon4 = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  830: 
  831:     erlang:demonitor(Mon2, [flush]),
  832: 
  833:     Mon5 = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  834:     Mon6 = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  835:     Mon7 = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  836: 
  837:     receive check_no_change_message -> ok end,
  838:     receive
  839:         {'CHANGE', _, time_offset, clock_service, _} ->
  840:             exit(unexpected_change_message_received)
  841:     after 0 ->
  842:               Leader ! {no_change_message_received, self()}
  843:     end,
  844:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  845:     erlang:demonitor(Mon4, [flush]),
  846:     receive
  847:         {'CHANGE', Mon3, time_offset, clock_service, _} ->
  848:             ok
  849:     end,
  850:     receive
  851:         {'CHANGE', Mon6, time_offset, clock_service, _} ->
  852:             ok
  853:     end,
  854:     erlang:demonitor(Mon5, [flush]),
  855:     receive
  856:         {'CHANGE', Mon7, time_offset, clock_service, _} ->
  857:             ok
  858:     end,
  859:     receive
  860:         {'CHANGE', Mon1, time_offset, clock_service, _} ->
  861:             ok
  862:     end,
  863:     receive
  864:         {'CHANGE', _, time_offset, clock_service, _} ->
  865:             exit(unexpected_change_message_received)
  866:     after 1000 ->
  867:               ok
  868:     end,
  869:     Leader ! {change_messages_received, self()}.
  870: 
  871: 
  872: monitor_tag_storage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  873:     process_flag(priority, max),
  874:     %% WHITEBOX:
  875:     %%
  876:     %% There are three scenarios we want to test. The receiver of the
  877:     %% DOWN message with tag:
  878:     %% * has on-heap message queue data enabled and can allocate
  879:     %%   DOWN message on the heap
  880:     %% * has on-heap message queue data enabled and cannot allocate
  881:     %%   DOWN message on the heap, i.e. the message will be allocated
  882:     %%   in a heap fragment
  883:     %% * has off-heap message queue data enabled, i.e. the message
  884:     %%   will be allocated in a combined message/heap fragment.
  885: 
  886:     %%
  887:     %% Testing the two on heap message queue data scenarios. Initially
  888:     %% there will be room on the heap, but eventually DOWN messages
  889:     %% will be placed in heap fragments.
  890:     %%    
  891:     ok = monitor_tag_storage_test(on_heap),
  892: 
  893:     %%
  894:     %% Testing the off heap message queue data scenarios.
  895:     %%
  896:     ok = monitor_tag_storage_test(off_heap).
  897: 
  898: monitor_tag_storage_test(MQD) ->
  899:     Len = 1000,
  900:     Tag = make_ref(),
  901:     Parent = self(),
  902:     Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  903:                            spawn_opt(fun () ->
  904:                                               receive after infinity -> ok end
  905:                                      end, [link,{priority,high}])
  906:                    end, lists:seq(1, Len)),
  907:     {Recvr, RMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  908:                                       lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
  909:                                                             erlang:monitor(process,
  910:                                                                            P,
  911:                                                                            [{tag, Tag}])
  912:                                                     end, Ps),
  913:                                       Parent ! {ready, self()},
  914:                                       receive {continue, Parent} -> ok end,
  915:                                       garbage_collect(),
  916:                                       Msgs = receive_tagged_down_msgs(Tag, []),
  917:                                       Len = length(Msgs),
  918:                                       garbage_collect(),
  919:                                       id(Msgs)
  920:                               end, [link, monitor, {message_queue_data, MQD}]),
  921:     receive {ready, Recvr} -> ok end,
  922:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> unlink(P), exit(P, bang) end, Ps),
  923:     wait_until(fun () ->
  924:                        {message_queue_len, Len} == process_info(Recvr,
  925:                                                                 message_queue_len)
  926:                end),
  927:     {messages, Msgs} = process_info(Recvr, messages),
  928:     lists:foreach(fun (Msg) ->
  929:                           {Tag, _Mon, process, _Pid, bang} = Msg
  930:                   end,
  931:                   Msgs),
  932:     garbage_collect(),
  933:     id(Msgs),
  934:     Recvr ! {continue, self()},
  935:     receive
  936:         {'DOWN', RMon, process, Recvr, Reason} ->
  937:             normal = Reason
  938:     end,
  939:     ok.
  940: 
  941: receive_tagged_down_msgs(Tag, Msgs) ->
  942:     receive
  943:         {Tag, _Mon, process, _Pid, bang} = Msg ->
  944:             receive_tagged_down_msgs(Tag, [Msg|Msgs])
  945:     after
  946:         0 ->
  947:             Msgs
  948:     end.
  949: 
  950: unexpected_alias_at_demonitor_gh5310(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  951:     %% The demonitor operation erroneously behaved as if the
  952:     %% monitor had been created using the {alias, explicit_unalias}
  953:     %% option...
  954:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () ->
  955:                              receive
  956:                                  {alias, Alias} ->
  957:                                      Alias ! {hello_via_alias, self()}
  958:                              end
  959:                      end),
  960:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  961:     AliasMon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid, [{alias, reply_demonitor}]),
  962:     erlang:demonitor(AliasMon, [flush]),
  963:     Pid ! {alias, AliasMon},
  964:     receive
  965:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, normal} ->
  966:             ok
  967:     end,
  968:     receive
  969:         {hello_via_alias, Pid} ->
  970:             ct:fail(unexpected_message_via_alias)
  971:     after
  972:         0 ->
  973:             ok
  974:     end.
  975: 
  976: down_on_alias_gh5310(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  977:     %% Could only occur when the internal monitor structure was transformed
  978:     %% into an alias structure during the demonitor() operation, the target
  979:     %% terminated before the demonitor signal reached it, and the exit reason
  980:     %% wasn't an immediate. We test with both immediate and compound exit
  981:     %% reason just to make sure we don't introduce the bug in the immediate
  982:     %% case at a later time...
  983:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
  984:     {DeMonSched, TermSched} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers) of
  985:                                   1 -> {1, 1};
  986:                                   2 -> {1, 2};
  987:                                   _ -> {2, 3}
  988:                               end,
  989:     lists:foreach(fun (N) ->
  990:                           ImmedExitReason = case N rem 2 of
  991:                                       0 -> true;
  992:                                       _ -> false
  993:                                   end,
  994:                           down_on_alias_gh5310_test(ImmedExitReason,
  995:                                                     DeMonSched, TermSched)
  996:                   end,
  997:                   lists:seq(1, 200)),
  998:     ok.
  999: 
 1000: down_on_alias_gh5310_test(ImmedExitReason, DeMonSched, TermSched) ->
 1001:     Go = make_ref(),
 1002:     Done = make_ref(),
 1003:     Parent = self(),
 1004:     TermPid = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1005:                                 Parent ! {ready, self()},
 1006:                                 receive Go ->
 1007:                                         if ImmedExitReason == true ->
 1008:                                                 exit(bye);
 1009:                                            true ->
 1010:                                                 exit(Go)
 1011:                                         end
 1012:                                 end
 1013:                         end, [{scheduler, TermSched}]),
 1014:     DeMonPid = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1015:                                  AliasMon = erlang:monitor(process, TermPid,
 1016:                                                            [{alias, explicit_unalias}]),
 1017:                                  Parent ! {ready, self()},
 1018:                                  receive Go -> ok end,
 1019:                                  erlang:demonitor(AliasMon, [flush]),
 1020:                                  busy_wait_until(fun () ->
 1021:                                                          not is_process_alive(TermPid)
 1022:                                                  end),
 1023:                                  receive
 1024:                                      {'DOWN', AliasMon, process, _, _} = DownMsg ->
 1025:                                          exit({unexpected_msg, DownMsg})
 1026:                                  after
 1027:                                      0 ->
 1028:                                          Parent ! Done
 1029:                                  end
 1030:                          end, [{scheduler, DeMonSched}, link]),
 1031:     receive {ready, TermPid} -> ok end,
 1032:     receive {ready, DeMonPid} -> ok end,
 1033:     erlang:yield(),
 1034:     TermPid ! Go,
 1035:     DeMonPid ! Go,
 1036:     receive Done -> ok end.
 1037: 
 1038: 
 1039: monitor_3_noproc_gh6185(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1040:     monitor_3_noproc_gh6185_test(false, false),
 1041:     monitor_3_noproc_gh6185_test(true, false),
 1042:     monitor_3_noproc_gh6185_test(false, true),
 1043:     monitor_3_noproc_gh6185_test(true, true),
 1044:     monitor_3_noproc_gh6185_exit_test(false, false),
 1045:     monitor_3_noproc_gh6185_exit_test(true, false),
 1046:     monitor_3_noproc_gh6185_exit_test(false, true),
 1047:     monitor_3_noproc_gh6185_exit_test(true, true).
 1048: 
 1049: monitor_3_noproc_gh6185_test(AliasTest, TagTest) ->
 1050:     NodeName = node(),
 1051:     UN = undefined_name_gh6185,
 1052:     UNN = {UN, NodeName},
 1053:     undefined = whereis(UN),
 1054: 
 1055:     {AliasOpt, CheckAlias}
 1056:         = case AliasTest of
 1057:               false ->
 1058:                   {[], fun (_NotAnAlias) -> ok end};
 1059:               true ->
 1060:                   {[{alias, explicit_unalias}],
 1061:                    fun (Alias) ->
 1062:                            AMsg1 = make_ref(),
 1063:                            OMsg1 = make_ref(),
 1064:                            Alias ! AMsg1,
 1065:                            self() ! OMsg1,
 1066:                            receive OMsg1 -> ok end,
 1067:                            receive AMsg1 -> ok
 1068:                            after 0 -> ct:fail(missing_alias_message)
 1069:                            end,
 1070:                            unalias(Alias),
 1071:                            AMsg2 = make_ref(),
 1072:                            OMsg2 = make_ref(),
 1073:                            Alias ! AMsg2,
 1074:                            self() ! OMsg2,
 1075:                            receive OMsg2 -> ok end,
 1076:                            receive AMsg2 -> ct:fail(unexpected_alias_message)
 1077:                            after 0 -> ok
 1078:                            end
 1079:                    end}
 1080:           end,
 1081: 
 1082:     TagFun = case TagTest of
 1083:                  false ->
 1084:                      fun () ->
 1085:                              {'DOWN', []}
 1086:                      end;
 1087:                  true ->
 1088:                      fun () ->
 1089:                              Tag = make_ref(),
 1090:                              {Tag, [{tag, Tag}]}
 1091:                      end
 1092:              end,
 1093: 
 1094:     %% not registerd process...
 1095:     {Tag1, TagOpt1} = TagFun(),
 1096:     M1 = erlang:monitor(process, UN, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt1),
 1097:     receive
 1098:         {Tag1, M1, process, UNN, noproc} ->
 1099:             ok;
 1100:         ID1 when element(2, ID1) == M1 ->
 1101:             ct:fail({invalid_down, ID1})
 1102:     after 100 ->
 1103:             ct:fail(missing_down)
 1104:     end,
 1105:     CheckAlias(M1),
 1106: 
 1107:     {Tag2, TagOpt2} = TagFun(),
 1108:     M2 = erlang:monitor(process, UNN, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt2),
 1109:     receive
 1110:         {Tag2, M2, process, UNN, noproc} ->
 1111:             ok;
 1112:         ID2 when element(2, ID2) == M2 ->
 1113:             ct:fail({invalid_down, ID2})
 1114:     after 100 ->
 1115:             ct:fail(missing_down)
 1116:     end,
 1117:     CheckAlias(M2),
 1118: 
 1119:     %% Not registered port...
 1120:     {Tag3, TagOpt3} = TagFun(),
 1121:     M3 = erlang:monitor(port, UN, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt3),
 1122:     receive
 1123:         {Tag3, M3, port, UNN, noproc} ->
 1124:             ok;
 1125:         ID3 when element(2, ID3) == M3 ->
 1126:             ct:fail({invalid_down, ID3})
 1127:     after 100 ->
 1128:             ct:fail(missing_down)
 1129:     end,
 1130:     CheckAlias(M3),
 1131: 
 1132:     {Tag4, TagOpt4} = TagFun(),
 1133:     M4 = erlang:monitor(port, UNN, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt4),
 1134:     receive
 1135:         {Tag4, M4, port, UNN, noproc} ->
 1136:             ok;
 1137:         ID4 when element(2, ID4) == M4 ->
 1138:             ct:fail({invalid_down, ID4})
 1139:     after 100 ->
 1140:             ct:fail(missing_down)
 1141:     end,
 1142:     CheckAlias(M4),
 1143: 
 1144: 
 1145:     OldCreation = case erlang:system_info(creation) of
 1146:                       Creation when Creation =< 4 -> 16#ffffffff;
 1147:                       Creation -> Creation - 1
 1148:                   end,
 1149: 
 1150:     %% Process of old incarnation...
 1151:     Pid = erts_test_utils:mk_ext_pid({NodeName, OldCreation}, 4711, 0),
 1152:     {Tag5, TagOpt5} = TagFun(),
 1153:     M5 = erlang:monitor(process, Pid, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt5),
 1154:     receive
 1155:         {Tag5, M5, process, Pid, noproc} ->
 1156:             ok;
 1157:         ID5 when element(2, ID5) == M5 ->
 1158:             ct:fail({invalid_down, ID5})
 1159:     after 100 ->
 1160:             ct:fail(missing_down)
 1161:     end,
 1162:     CheckAlias(M5),
 1163: 
 1164:     %% Port of old incarnation...
 1165:     Prt = erts_test_utils:mk_ext_port({NodeName, OldCreation}, 4711),
 1166:     {Tag6, TagOpt6} = TagFun(),
 1167:     M6 = erlang:monitor(port, Prt, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt6),
 1168:     receive
 1169:         {Tag6, M6, port, Prt, noproc} ->
 1170:             ok;
 1171:         ID6 when element(2, ID6) == M6 ->
 1172:             ct:fail({invalid_down, ID6})
 1173:     after 100 ->
 1174:             ct:fail(missing_down)
 1175:     end,
 1176:     CheckAlias(M6),
 1177: 
 1178:     ok.
 1179: 
 1180: monitor_3_noproc_gh6185_exit_test(AliasTest, TagTest) ->
 1181:     %%
 1182:     %% Testing that we handle these quite unusual monitors correct
 1183:     %% in case the monotoring process dies right after setting up
 1184:     %% the monitor. We cannot check any results, but we might hit
 1185:     %% asserts, crashes, or memory leaks if any bugs exist...
 1186:     %%
 1187: 
 1188:     NodeName = node(),
 1189:     UN = undefined_name_gh6185,
 1190:     UNN = {UN, NodeName},
 1191:     undefined = whereis(UN),
 1192: 
 1193:     AliasOpt = case AliasTest of
 1194:                    false -> [];
 1195:                    true -> [{alias, explicit_unalias}]
 1196:                end,
 1197: 
 1198:     TagOpt = case TagTest of
 1199:                  false -> [];
 1200:                  true -> [{tag, make_ref()}]
 1201:              end,
 1202: 
 1203:     %% not registerd process...
 1204:     {P1, M1} = spawn_monitor(fun () ->
 1205:                                      erlang:yield(),
 1206:                                      _ = erlang:monitor(process, UN, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt),
 1207:                                      exit(bang)
 1208:                              end),
 1209:     receive {'DOWN', M1, process, P1, bang} -> ok end,
 1210:     {P2, M2} = spawn_monitor(fun () ->
 1211:                                      erlang:yield(),
 1212:                                      _ = erlang:monitor(process, UNN, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt),
 1213:                                      exit(bang)
 1214:                              end),
 1215:     receive {'DOWN', M2, process, P2, bang} -> ok end,
 1216: 
 1217:     %% Not registered port...
 1218:     {P3, M3} = spawn_monitor(fun () ->
 1219:                                      erlang:yield(),
 1220:                                      _ = erlang:monitor(port, UN, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt),
 1221:                                      exit(bang)
 1222:                              end),
 1223:     receive {'DOWN', M3, process, P3, bang} -> ok end,
 1224:     {P4, M4} = spawn_monitor(fun () ->
 1225:                                      erlang:yield(),
 1226:                                      _ = erlang:monitor(port, UNN, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt),
 1227:                                      exit(bang)
 1228:                              end),
 1229:     receive {'DOWN', M4, process, P4, bang} -> ok end,
 1230: 
 1231: 
 1232:     OldCreation = case erlang:system_info(creation) of
 1233:                       Creation when Creation =< 4 -> 16#ffffffff;
 1234:                       Creation -> Creation - 1
 1235:                   end,
 1236: 
 1237:     %% Process of old incarnation...
 1238:     {P5, M5} = spawn_monitor(fun () ->
 1239:                                      Pid = erts_test_utils:mk_ext_pid({NodeName,
 1240:                                                                        OldCreation},
 1241:                                                                       4711, 0),
 1242:                                      erlang:yield(),
 1243:                                      _ = erlang:monitor(process, Pid, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt),
 1244:                                      exit(bang)
 1245:                              end),
 1246:     receive {'DOWN', M5, process, P5, bang} -> ok end,
 1247: 
 1248:     %% Port of old incarnation...
 1249:     {P6, M6} = spawn_monitor(fun () ->
 1250:                                      Prt = erts_test_utils:mk_ext_port({NodeName,
 1251:                                                                         OldCreation},
 1252:                                                                        4711),
 1253:                                      erlang:yield(),
 1254:                                      _ = erlang:monitor(port, Prt, AliasOpt ++ TagOpt),
 1255:                                      exit(bang)
 1256:                              end),
 1257:     receive {'DOWN', M6, process, P6, bang} -> ok end,
 1258:     ok.
 1259: 
 1260: %%
 1261: %% ...
 1262: %%
 1263: 
 1264: id(X) -> X.
 1265: 
 1266: busy_wait_until(Fun) ->
 1267:     case catch Fun() of
 1268:         true ->
 1269:             ok;
 1270:         _ ->
 1271:             busy_wait_until(Fun)
 1272:     end.
 1273: 
 1274: wait_until(Fun) ->
 1275:     case catch Fun() of
 1276:         true ->
 1277:             ok;
 1278:         _ ->
 1279:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1280:             wait_until(Fun)
 1281:     end.
 1282: 
 1283: wait_for_m(_,_,0) ->
 1284:     exit(monitor_wait_timeout);
 1285: wait_for_m(Monitors, MonitoredBy, N) ->
 1286:     {monitors,M0}  = process_info(self(),monitors),
 1287:     {monitored_by,MB0} = process_info(self(),monitored_by),
 1288:     case lists:sort(M0) of
 1289:         Monitors ->
 1290:             case lists:sort(MB0) of
 1291:                 MonitoredBy ->
 1292:                     ok;
 1293:                 _ ->
 1294:                     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1295:                     wait_for_m(Monitors,MonitoredBy,N-1)
 1296:             end;
 1297:         _ ->
 1298:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1299:             wait_for_m(Monitors,MonitoredBy,N-1)
 1300:     end.
 1301: 
 1302: % All permutations of a list...
 1303: perm([]) ->
 1304:     [];
 1305: perm([X]) ->
 1306:     [[X]];
 1307: perm(List) ->
 1308:     perm([],List,[]).
 1309: 
 1310: perm(_,[],Acc) ->
 1311:     Acc;
 1312: perm(Pre,[El|Post],Acc) ->
 1313:     Res = [[El|X] || X <- perm(Pre ++ Post)],
 1314:     perm(Pre ++ [El], Post, Res ++ Acc).
 1315: 
 1316: 
 1317: %%% Our butler for named process monitor tests
 1318: 
 1319: jeeves(Parent, Name, Ref) 
 1320:   when is_pid(Parent), (is_atom(Name) or (Name =:= [])), is_reference(Ref) ->
 1321:     %%io:format("monitor_SUITE:jeeves(~p, ~p)~n", [Parent, Name]),
 1322:     case Name of
 1323:         Atom when is_atom(Atom) ->
 1324:             register(Name, self());
 1325:         [] ->
 1326:             ok
 1327:     end,
 1328:     Parent ! {self(), Ref},
 1329:     jeeves_loop(Parent).
 1330: 
 1331: jeeves_loop(Parent) ->
 1332:     receive
 1333:         {Parent, monitors} ->
 1334:             Parent ! {self(), {monitors, monitors()}},
 1335:             jeeves_loop(Parent);
 1336:         {Parent, {monitor_process, P}} ->
 1337:             Parent ! {self(), {monitor_process, 
 1338:                                catch erlang:monitor(process, P) }},
 1339:             jeeves_loop(Parent);
 1340:         {Parent, {demonitor, Ref}} ->
 1341:             Parent ! {self(), {demonitor, catch erlang:demonitor(Ref)}},
 1342:             jeeves_loop(Parent);
 1343:         {Parent, stop} ->
 1344:             ok;
 1345:         {Parent, {exit, Reason}} ->
 1346:             exit(Reason);
 1347:         Other ->
 1348:             io:format("~p:jeeves_loop received ~p~n", [?MODULE, Other])
 1349:     end.
 1350: 
 1351: 
 1352: start_jeeves({Name, Node}) 
 1353:   when (is_atom(Name) or (Name =:= [])), is_atom(Node) ->
 1354:     Parent = self(),
 1355:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1356:     Pid = spawn(Node, fun() -> jeeves(Parent, Name, Ref) end),
 1357:     receive 
 1358:         {Pid, Ref} -> 
 1359:             ok;
 1360:         Other ->
 1361:             ct:fail({rec, Other})
 1362:     end,
 1363:     Pid;
 1364: start_jeeves(Name) when is_atom(Name) ->
 1365:     start_jeeves({Name, node()}).
 1366: 
 1367: 
 1368: tell_jeeves(Pid, What) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1369:     Pid ! {self(), What}.
 1370: 
 1371: 
 1372: ask_jeeves(Pid, Request) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1373:     Pid ! {self(), Request},
 1374:     receive
 1375:         {Pid, Response} ->
 1376:             Response;
 1377:         Other ->
 1378:             ct:fail({rec, Other})
 1379:     end.
 1380: 
 1381: 
 1382: expect_jeeves(Pid, Request, Response) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1383:     Pid ! {self(), Request},
 1384:     receive 
 1385:         {Pid, Response} -> 
 1386:             ok;
 1387:         Other ->
 1388:             ct:fail({rec, Other})
 1389:     end.
 1390: 
 1391: 
 1392: monitors() ->
 1393:     monitors(self()).
 1394: 
 1395: monitors(Pid) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1396:     {monitors, Monitors}          = process_info(self(), monitors),
 1397:     {monitored_by,  MonitoredBy}  = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 1398:     {Monitors, MonitoredBy}.
 1399: 
 1400: generate(_Fun, 0) ->
 1401:     [];
 1402: generate(Fun, N) ->
 1403:     [Fun() | generate(Fun, N-1)].
